sentence.Network_en: I asked the Captain to wangle us three tickets to Athens.
sentence.Network_cn: 我让机长设法给我们弄3张去雅典的票。

sentence.Network_en: We managed to wangle a few days' leave.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们设法骗到了几天的假。

sentence.Network_en: The family depended on his ability to wangle a few dollars occasionally . With this money, they would eat well and dress well for a while , making a pretence of affluence.
sentence.Network_cn: 一家人全靠他在外面讹个钱,诈个财, 吃点好的,穿点好的, 装门面.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent. (first recorded as printers' slang): of unknown origin; perhaps based on the verb waggle

entry.def: If you wangle something that you want, you manage to get it by being clever or persuading someone.

example.ex: We managed to wangle a few days' leave...
example.tran: 我们设法骗到了几天的假。

example.ex: He had wangled his way into the country without a visa...
example.tran: 他在没有签证的情况下设法混进了那个国家。

means.word_mean: 1. an instance of accomplishing something by scheming or trickery
1. achieve something by means of trickery or devious methods

auth_sentence.content: The noise of John Wangle's yelling...arouses many of the neighbors.
auth_sentence.res_content: The noise of John Wangle's yelling...arouses many of the neighbors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The noise of John Wangle's yelling...arouses many of the neighbors.

auth_sentence.content: Through that contact I was able to wangle an internship with Disney.
auth_sentence.res_content: Through that contact I was able to wangle an internship with Disney.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Through that contact I was able to wangle an internship with Disney.

auth_sentence.content: I hoped I could come...to see you, but I couldn't wangle it.
auth_sentence.res_content: I hoped I could come...to see you, but I couldn't wangle it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I hoped I could come...to see you, but I couldn't wangle it.

means.word_mean: <口>用计谋得到(好处等),哄骗;伪造

sentences.en: to wangle an invitation to a party
sentences.cn: 用诈骗手段得到 一张参加集会的请柬
用不正当手段获得某物
